Important Notice

July 2019

  • 7/1Linux kernel TCP SACK denial of service vulnerability

    Newly disclosed security vulnerabilities (CVE-2019-11477, CVE-2019-11478, CVE-2019-11479) may cause the Linux operating system to the risk of "denial of service (DoS)". For customers running IaaS Linux virtual machines, please contact the providers of Linux distributions for guidance. For customers using Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) and HDInsight, please refer to the following documents:

    • Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS): https://github.com/Azure/AKS/issues/1065
    • HDInsight: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/updates/security-advisory-on-linux-kernel-tcp-vulnerabilities-for-hdinsight-clusters/

    See Microsoft Security Notice 190020 for more information.

January 2019

  • 1/14Azure App Services have updated Python 3.4.1 to 3.6.6

    To solve the known security issue in Python 3.4.1, we have updated all App Services running Python 3.4.1. Original Python 3.4.1 has been updated to Python 3.6.6.

    We suggest you to run a test for App Services and update the code, to ensure your websites fully compatible with the new version of Python.

    If you need to force App Services to run the old version of Python for special reasons, please refer to our GitHub announcement: https://github.com/Azure/app-service-announcements/issues/144

December 2018

  • 12/28Azure Cognitive Services Emotion API will be deprecated - Please migrate to Face API by February 15, 2019

    Our Face API has now been officially released. It can detect emotions displayed on human faces in your applications. As the existing Emotion API features have been fully replaced by the Face API, we will deprecate Emotion API on February 15, 2019.

    To continue using Emotion API, please migrate to Face API by the stated date. We encourage you to make the switch as soon as possible to take advantage of Face API, which includes richer facial recognition features, service level agreements, and full Azure support.

    Please migrate to Face API by February 15, 2019, to prevent any service disruption to your applications and fully utilize emotion recognition features.

  • 12/18Diagnostic settings in Azure IoT Hub (IoT Hub) to replace operations monitoring, please migrate by March 10, 2019

    Diagnostic settings in Azure Monitor provide a single, simplified monitoring and logging experience. Azure Monitor and Azure IoT Hub are fully integrated, which can help you to keep your IoT solutions running in a healthy state. As diagnostic settings have replaced operations monitoring in Azure IoT Hub, the operations monitoring will be deprecated on March 10, 2019.

    To continue to collect logs on Azure IoT Hub without disruption, please migrate to diagnostic settings by March 10, 2019, at which time operations monitoring will be completely removed from the Hub and the support for it will end.

    Learn about details of using diagnostic settings to monitor the operations and health of Hub.

November 2018

  • 11/30We are ending the MySQL Database on Azure service on December 1, 2019. This will be replaced by the Azure Database for MySQL service.

    Azure Database for MySQL provides fully managed, enterprise-level MySQL database as a service. With Azure Database for MySQL:

    • Customers can easily migrate to the cloud, using languages and frameworks of their choice.
    • Customers get built-in high availability and dynamic scaling, helping them easily adjust to changes in their demands.
    • Customers will benefit from the unparalleled security and compliance, including Azure IP Advantage.

    All these services come with a flexible pricing model so customers can choose resources for their workloads with no hidden cost. To find out more about Azure Database for MySQL, please see the Product Function page and Price Details page.

    If you are an existing customer:

    • You will be automatically migrated to the new service before the end of life of the existing service.
    • User business continuity is supported. When your server(s) has been scheduled for migration, we estimate the total downtime for migration per server to be less than 10 minutes in most cases. However, the exact downtime depends on the size and change rate of your existing MySQL Database on Azure instances.
    • Migration will begin on Feb 15th, 2019.
    • Special pricing will be lost when scaled to a different service tier or if server is deleted.
    • You will continue to pay the same price post migration. Detailed information about the SKU mapping between the old service and the new service will be published before end of December 2018.
    • There is no action necessary for now. At a minimum, 30 days prior to your scheduled migration, you will receive additional notifications including the exact timeline for your migration.

    If you are a new customer:

    • You will not be accepted on the “MySQL Database on Azure” service as of the date of this announcement

    Please refer to MySQL Database on Azure Migration FAQs for the most common questions related to this migration

  • 11/16Azure Support Plan Notification

    We will be offering our new support plan from December 15. To deliver better experiences with Azure, we will continue to offer technical support services free-of-charge for enterprises. Customers who signed up for 21Vianet's Online Service Standard Agreement (OSSA) within the period of validity of your Azure agreement will get the “Developer” Support Plan. Customers who signed up for 21Vianet's Online Service Premier Agreement (OSPA) within the period of validity of your Azure agreement will get the “Standard” Support Plan. If you run business-critical workloads on Azure and would like to access services to satisfy the below needs, you may choose the paid “enterprise-tier” Premier Support Plan. Please contact your account manager for more details concerning purchase and use of “enterprise-tier” support plans.

    • Designated service delivery manager committed to improve your Azure experience.
    • Highest priority reactive support to help ensure business continuity of your services.

    Please clickhere for more details of support plans.

    In addition, adjusted phone service hours are from 9am to 9pm, Monday-Sunday since Dec 1st, 2018. For frequently asked questions on Azure, we recommend you get answers to your questions fast through Online Customer Service or WeChat Official Accounts (Azure Cloud Technical Support).

October 2018

  • 10/31We have updated our Privacy Statement for Online Services

    Your privacy is of critical importance to us. We strive to protect your personal information. Therefore, we have updated our Privacy Statement and would like to share the updates with you. The updates takes effect as from today.

    In particular, we have combined the Privacy Statements of Azure and Office 365 and made adjustments as shown below:

    1. Enhanced your rights to your personal information

    • Further strengthened your control over your personal information, including your right to know, right to choose, right of revocation and right to amend.
    • Clarified the principles such as storage constraints so as to ensure information will be deleted immediately following the end of the lifecycle or your personal information will be anonymized and etc.
    • Introduced our protection mechanism for your personal information, including protection for the personal information of minors.
    • Clarified that we would obtain your consent in advance with regards to the use of your personal information for purposes not covered by this privacy policy.

    2. A more transparent approach in introducing how your personal data would be processed

    • Clarified the boundaries of “personal information” and “sensitive personal information” and explained to you the scenarios that might involve “personal information” when 21Vianet Online Services collects and uses your information.
    • Covered a series of scenarios with regards to our collection of personal information. For example, we would collect your personal information through the process of real-name authentication when you use 21Vianet Online Services. In addition, we would also collect your personal information through websites and marketing activities.
    • Introduced how we would share your personal information, including sharing with external subjects.

    We encourage you to read the full Privacy Statement and understand the updates we made. If you have any questions or thoughts, please contact us through Azure support.

    Readfull Privacy Statement.

August 2018

  • Risk Warning: Linux denial of service vulnerability

    8/15: Another security vulnerability called “FragmentSmack” (CVE-2018-5391) also leads to denial of service (DoS) of Linux operating system. We have taken proper protective measures to ensure Microsoft cloud platform’s customers (Azure and Microsoft 365) free from the affection of this vulnerability. You do not need to take any immediate protective actions. However, as a best practice, we still recommend that you regularly consult each Linux distribution provider to install the latest updates for Linux Virtual Machines running on the Azure platform. You can consult each Linux distribution provider for more information on Linux security vulnerabilities.

    8/7: We noticed that a newly disclosed security vulnerability (CVE-2018-5390) may cause the Linux operating system to temporarily fall into a “Denial of Service (DoS)” state. Virtual Machines running the Linux operating system may be vulnerable to this attack, but Azure hosting platform will not be affected. We are currently working with numerous Linux distribution providers to help them address this security issue. Please contact each Linux distribution provider for guidance on how to address the CVE-2018-5390 security vulnerability. For more information on this vulnerability, please visit the Vulnerability Notes Database at https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/962459.

    We will continue to update this security notice as the case progresses.

July 2018

  • 7/16PHP minor version + Xdebug update notifications

    In August 2018, Azure App Services will stack update PHP to the latest version. For information about changes in the latest version, please see the change logs on the PHP website.

    PHP Versions Change Logs
    7.1.19 http://www.php.net/ChangeLog-7.php#7.1.19
    7.2.7 http://www.php.net/ChangeLog-7.php#7.2.7

    We will also update the Xdebug binary files, which will include adding Xdebug support for PHP versions 7.1 and 7.2.

    PHP Versions Xdebug Path
    5.6 D:\devtools\xdebug\2.5.5\php_5.6\php_xdebug-2.5.5-5.6-vc11-nts.dll
    7.0 x86 D:\devtools\xdebug\2.6.0\php_7.0\php_xdebug-2.6.0-7.0-vc14-nts.dll
    7.0 x64 D:\devtools\xdebug\2.6.0\php_7.0\php_xdebug-2.6.0-7.0-vc14-nts-x86_64.dll
    7.1 x86 (new) D:\devtools\xdebug\2.6.0\php_7.1\php_xdebug-2.6.0-7.1-vc14-nts.dll
    7.1 x64 (new) D:\devtools\xdebug\2.6.0\php_7.1\php_xdebug-2.6.0-7.1-vc14-nts-x86_64.dll
    7.2 x86 (new) D:\devtools\xdebug\2.6.0\php_7.2\php_xdebug-2.6.0-7.2-vc15-nts.dll

    Please note that the paths for xdebug.dll will be updated to the paths in the image above. We will delete the old xdebug.dll paths, including:

    Xdebug paths to be deleted:

    D:\devtools\xdebug\2.4.0\php_5.4\php_xdebug-2.4.0-5.4-vc9-nts.dll

    D:\devtools\xdebug\2.4.0\php_5.5\php_xdebug-2.4.0-5.5-vc11-nts.dll

    D:\devtools\xdebug\2.4.0\php_5.6\php_xdebug-2.4.0-5.6-vc11-nts.dll

    D:\devtools\xdebug\2.4.0\php_7.0\php_xdebug-2.4.0-7.0-vc14-nts-x86_64.dll

    D:\devtools\xdebug\2.4.0\php_7.0\php_xdebug-2.4.0-7.0-vc14-nts.dll

    For more information about how to use the right version of Xdebug for your version of PHP, see the Xdebug Blog.

Product Update

Expand All

July 2019

  • 7/2Azure Time Series Insights has now been officially released in China East 2 and China North 2 data centers

    Azure Time Series Insights is a managed analytics and visualization service that democratizes the Internet of Things (IoT) by making it simple to explore and analyze your IoT time series data. It lets you quickly validate your IoT solution and avoid downtime to mission-critical devices by helping you discover hidden trends, spot anomalies, and conduct root-cause analyses in near real-time. It also offers up to 400 days of real-time analytics and storage of time series data, helping organizations to spot and understand longer-term trends in their IoT data. It provides powerful data exploration and telemetry tools to help you improve operational analysis.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Azure Time Series Insights Feature page and Azure Time Series Insights Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure Time Series Insights Documentation page.

  • 7/1Shanghai Telecom and Beijing Telecom are providing the ExpressRoute connectivity service in China East 2 and China North 2 data centers respectively

    You can contact Shanghai Telecom and Beijing Telecom to establish an ExpressRoute private network connection in China East 2 and China North 2 data centers. ExpressRoute connections don't go over the public internet, and offer more reliability, faster speeds, and lower latencies than internet connections.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit ExpressRoute Feature page and ExpressRoute Price Details page. For more details, please visit ExpressRoute Documentation page.

  • 7/1Data inbound traffic, Virtual Machines, CDN, Cosmos DB, and Storage services discount

    Since July 1, 2019, data inbound traffic, Virtual Machines, CDN, Cosmos DB, and Storage services have been reduced in price.

    Data inbound traffic is free of charge. To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Azure Data Transfer Price Details page.

    Azure virtual machine prices lower up to 73%. To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Azure Virtual Machines Feature page and Azure Virtual Machines Price Details page.

    Content Delivery Network (CDN) prices lower up to 41%. To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Content Delivery Network (CDN) Feature page and Content Delivery Network (CDN) Price Details page.

    Azure Cosmos DB prices lower up to 38%. To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Azure Cosmos DB Feature page and Azure Cosmos DB Price Detailspage.

    Storage prices lower up to 21%. To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Storage Feature page and Storage Price Details page.

June 2019

  • 6/28Azure Media Services has now been officially released in China East 2 and China North 2 data centers

    Azure Media Services is a cloud-based media workflow platform that enables developers to build scalable media management and delivery applications. Azure Media Services makes it easy to use high-definition video encoding and streaming services to reach your audiences on today’s most popular devices. You can build end-to-end media workflows, securely upload, store, encode, and package video or audio content for both on-demand and live streaming delivery to various clients (for example, TV, PC, and mobile devices).

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Azure Media Services Feature page and Azure Media Services Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure Media Services Documentation page.

  • 6/27Azure Data Explorer officially released

    Azure Data Explorer is a highly scalable and secure data analysis service that can analyze mass data streamed from applications, websites and IoT devices in real time. Ask questions and dynamically browse data in an iterative way to improve products, customer experiences, monitor devices, and support operations. Quickly identify patterns, anomalies, and trends in data, discover new issues and get answers in minutes. Azure Data Explorer makes it simple to ingest this data and enables you to perform complex ad hoc queries on the data in seconds.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Azure Data Explorer Feature page and Azure Data Explorer Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure Data Explorer Documentation page.

  • 6/26Azure Application Insights has now been officially released in the China East 2 data center

    Azure Application Insights, as a part of Azure Monitor, is an extensible Application Performance Management (APM) service for web developers on multiple platforms. It can monitor your live web application and automatically detect performance anomalies. It includes powerful analytics tools to help you diagnose issues and to understand what users actually do with your app. It's designed to help you continuously improve performance and usability. It works for apps on a wide variety of platforms including .NET, Node.js and Java EE, hosted on-premises, hybrid, or any public cloud.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Azure Application Insights Feature page and Azure Application Insights Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure Application Insights Documentation page.

  • 6/25Azure Security Center officially released

    Azure Security Center provides comprehensive security management and advanced threat protection across hybrid cloud workloads, helping customers protect workloads running locally and in Azure from network threats. With Azure’s global threat intelligence and expertise, it automatically collects and analyze security-related events in Azure deployment to identify immediate threats and reduce false positives, providing quick fix solutions.

    To understand more about this service and its pricing, please visit Azure Security Center Feature page and Azure Security Center Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure Security Center Documentation page.

  • 6/25Azure Data Factory officially released

    Azure Data Factory is a cloud-based data integration service that allows you to create data-driven workflows in the cloud for orchestrating and automating data movement and data transformation. Easily construct ETL and ELT processes code-free within the intuitive visual environment, or write your own code. Visually integrate data sources using more than 80 natively built and maintenance-free connectors at no added cost. Focus on your data—the serverless integration service does the rest.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Azure Data Factory Feature page and Azure Data Factory Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure Data Factory Documentation page.

  • 6/24Azure Cognitive Services Language Understanding API standard officially released

    The Text Request feature of Azure Cognitive Services Language Understanding API standard has been officially released. Applications can understand a user's conversational, natural language text, predict overall meaning, and pull out relevant, detailed information. A client application for LUIS is any conventional application that communicates with a user in natural language to complete a task. Examples of client applications include social media apps, chat bots, and speech-enabled desktop applications.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Language Understanding API Feature page and Language Understanding API Price Details page. For more details, please visit Language Understanding API Documentation page.

  • 6/13Azure HDInsight Av2 Series and Ev3 Series officially released

    Azure HDInsight is a fully-managed cloud service that makes it easy, fast, and cost-effective to process massive amounts of data. The Av2 Series now officially released runs on the latest Av2 standard virtual machines, with the same CPU performance but faster disk speed. The Ev3 Series runs on Ev3 standard virtual machines and can achieve cache throughout and local disk throughput of up to 128,000 IOPS at 1024MBps (using 32 data disks).

    To learn more about this service and pricing, please visit Azure HDInsight Feature page and Azure HDInsight Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure HDInsight Documentation page.

  • 6/12Azure Database for MariaDB has now been officially released in China East 2 and China North 2 data centers

    Azure Database for MariaDB is a relational database service based on the open-source MariaDB Server engine. It is a fully managed community version of MariaDB that can be used by enterprises. The service has characteristics of open-source compatibility, built-in high availability, dynamic scaling and flexible pricing. With MariaDB Community Version, you can create scalable computing and storage resources using popular open-source frameworks, tools and languages. Azure Database for MariaDB makes it easy and fast to build smart applications.

    To learn more about this service and pricing, please visit Azure Database for MariaDB Feature page and Azure Database for MariaDB Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure Database for MariaDB Documentation page.

  • 6/11Azure SQL Database Managed Instance preview released

    Azure SQL Database Managed Instance provides the broadest SQL Server engine compatibility and native virtual network support so you can migrate a large number of SQL Server databases from on-premises or virtual machines to SQL Database Managed Instance without changing your apps. Managed Instance combines rich SQL Server interface areas with fully managed service operations. It also retains all PaaS functions (automatic patching, version update, automatic backup, and high availability) and can significantly reduce management overhead and total cost of ownership.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Azure SQL Database Feature page and Azure SQL Database Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure SQL Database Managed Instance Documentation page.

  • 6/4Azure Cache for Redis Premium tier P5 officially released

    Azure Cache for Redis is a distributed memory management cache based on open source software Redis. It can improve the system performance and scalability of back-end data storage, and temporarily copy frequently accessed data to fast storage close to applications. With the characteristics of higher cache performance, larger workload supported, and disaster recovery capability, it is specially designed for maximum scale and enterprise integration. The officially released Premium tier P5 has a cache size of 120GB and the customer connections can reach 40,000.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Azure Cache for Redis Feature page and Azure Cache for Redis Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure Cache for Redis Documentation page.

May 2019

  • 5/30Azure Active Directory B2C preview released

    Azure Active Directory B2C is a cloud identity service built on Azure Active Directory platform. It authenticates with popular social identity providers in China (such as Weibo, WeChat and QQ) through multi-tenant and cloud service support. It is application-oriented, highly available global identity management service that can be extended to hundreds of millions of identities. It can be easily integrated across mobile and Web platforms, and your customers can log in to applications using existing social accounts or creating new authentication information through a fully customizable experience.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Azure Active Directory B2C Feature page and Azure Active Directory B2C Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure Active Directory B2C Documentation page.

  • 5/27The preview version of Azure SQL Database serverless computing released

    Azure SQL Database serverless computing has optimized its price performance and simplified the performance management of intermittent and unpredictable database. According to the requirement of workload, the auto scaling of single database computing is available and the used computing is charged on a basis of second. During periods of inactivity, the computing is automatically suspended (only storage is charged at this time) and automatically resumed when the activity returns. Users will focus on building applications more quickly and efficiently due to serverless. Like all databases in SQL databases, serverless databases provide high availability and benefit from built-in intelligence for security and performance optimization.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Azure SQL Database Feature page and Azure SQL Database Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure SQL Database Serverless Compute Documentation page.

  • 5/2421Vianet Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) official version released

    Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) manages your hosted Kubernetes environment, making it quick and easy to deploy and manage containerized applications without container orchestration expertise. It also eliminates the burden of ongoing operations and maintenance by provisioning, upgrading, and scaling resources on demand, without taking your applications offline.

    To understand more about this service, please visit Azure Kubernetes Feature page. Please contact 21Vianet sales or distributors for technical support and offer plan details of Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) in China. For more details, please visit Azure Kubernetes Service Documentation page.

  • 5/17The free version of Azure Cognitive Services Language Understanding API officially released

    Language Understanding API is one of Azure Cognitive Services. You can build your own self-defined language model to make any program or robot understand your command and execute corresponding operation. Powerful developer tools are combined with customizable pre-built apps and entity dictionaries, such as Calendar, Music, and Devices, so you can build and deploy a solution more quickly. Dictionaries are mined from the collective knowledge of the web and supply billions of entries, helping your model to correctly identify valuable information from user conversations.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Language Understanding API Feature page and Language Understanding API Price Details page. For more details, please visit Language Understanding API Document page.

  • 5/13The Azure SQL Database hyperscale service tier Gen5 has now been officially released in China East 2 and China North 2 data centers

    The Azure SQL Database hyperscale service tier is the latest service tier in the vCore-based purchase models, which can be adjusted on demand according to workload requirements. Each database can be quickly and automatically scaled to 100 TB, eliminating the demand for provisioning storage resources, while significantly tapping the potential of application growth to keep it from being limited by the storage size. This new service tier can also scale computing and storage resources independently, giving the flexibility to optimize workload performance. Azure SQL Database is massive and can be used for a single database deployment.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Azure SQL Database Feature page and Azure SQL Database Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure SQL Database Document page.

  • 5/9The Azure public IP prefix officially released

    The public IP prefix is a service in the public IP address. It is a reserved range of IP addresses for your public endpoints in Azure. You can use prefixes to simplify IP address management in Azure. You can change the firewall rules knowing the address range in advance and no longer need to assign IP addresses to new resources. With address prediction, you can dramatically reduce management overhead when scaling in Azure.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit Public IP Address Price Details page. For more details, please visit Public IP Address Document page.

  • 5/5Azure Managed Disks Large Capacity Disks have now been officially released

    Azure Managed Disks is a service that is designed and controlled by Azure for virtual disk files (VHDs) and storage accounts used by virtual machines.

    • Premium Managed Disks are high performance Solid State Drive (SSD) based Storage designed to support I/O intensive workloads with significantly high throughput and low latency. Premium Managed Disks types P60, P70, and P80 (with disk size of 8TB, 16TB, and 32TB respectively) have now been officially released.
    • Standard SSD Managed Disks, a low-cost SSD offering, are optimized for test and entry-level production workloads requiring consistent latency. Standard SSD Managed Disks types E60, E70, and E80 (with disk size of 8TB, 16TB, and 32TB respectively) have now been officially released.
    • Standard Managed Disks use Hard Disk Drive (HDD) based Storage media. They are best suited for dev/test and other infrequent access workloads that are less sensitive to performance variability. Standard Managed Disks types S60, S70, and S80 (with disk size of 8TB, 16TB, and 32TB respectively) have now been officially released.

    To understand more about this service and pricing, please visit Azure Managed Disks Feature page and Azure Managed Disks Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure Managed Disks Documentation page.

April 2019

  • 4/23Azure Virtual Machines SUSE Linux Enterprise Server Basic and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Priority officially released

    SUSE Linux Enterprise Server (SLES) is the world's leading modular operating system for secure open source servers and the first supported Enterprise Linux distribution on Azure. Its tuned kernel provides faster access to new and upcoming Azure features, helping users become more agile. SUSE Linux Enterprise Server Basic is the base version, and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Priority provides the following key features:

    • Automatic failover of the SAP HANA database;
    • Page cache limits able to maintain SAP application performance;
    • Built-in high availability cluster to reduce downtime;
    • Full system rollback, including service pack updates, to quickly recover errors;
    • Linux container with Docker for automated application deployment

    To understand more about this service and pricing, please visit Azure Virtual Machines Feature page and Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure Virtual Machines Documentation page.

  • 4/18The Azure IoT Hub Device Provisioning Service officially released in China East 2 and China North 2 data centers

    The Azure IoT Hub Device Provisioning Service, one of the features of Azure IoT Hub, allows you to make zero-touch device configurations for your Azure IoT Hub. With this feature, you can securely provision and register IoT devices on a large scale. The design of the Azure IoT Hub Device Provisioning Service takes supply chain challenges into full consideration and offers the infrastructure required to configure millions of devices in a secure and scalable manner.

    Azure IoT Hub Device Provisioning Service has now been officially released in China East 2 and China North 2 data centers. To learn more about this service and pricing, please visit Azure IoT Hub Feature page and Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure IoT Hub Device Provisioning Service Document page.

  • 4/17Azure HDInsight now officially released in China East 2 data center

    Azure HDInsight is a fully-managed cloud service that makes it easy, fast, and cost-effective to process massive amounts of data. Use popular open-source frameworks such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive, LLAP, Kafka, Storm, HBase, and more. Azure HDInsight enables a broad range of scenarios such as ETL, Data Warehousing, IoT, and more.

    Azure HDInsight Linux has now been officially released in China East 2 data center. To learn more about this service and pricing, please visit Azure HDInsight Services Feature page and Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure HDInsight Document page.

  • 4/10Azure Advisor officially released

    Azure Advisor is a free, personalized cloud consulting product that helps you follow best practices to optimize your Azure deployments. It analyzes your resource configuration and usage telemetry, and then recommends solutions that help you to increase cost-effectiveness, performance, and availability of Azure resources. Azure Advisor allows you to obtain the following workable recommendations:

    • High availability: Safeguards and improves the continuity of business-critical apps;
    • Performance: Increases the speed of apps;
    • Cost: Optimizes and reduces overall Azure expenditure.

    Azure Advisor has now been officially released. For more information about this service, please visit the Azure Advisor Service Functions page. For more detailed information, visit the Azure Advisor Documents page.

  • 4/5Azure Container Registry officially released in China East and China North data centers

    Azure Container Registry provides a hosted Docker registration service for storing and managing private container images. Azure Container Registry can work along with the existing container development and deployment channels. You can generate a container image in Azure using the Azure Container Registry Build. The source code submission and base image update can be used to generate triggers on demand as needed or fully automatically.

    Azure Container Registry has been officially released in China East and China North data centers. To learn more about this service and pricing, please visit the Container Registry Service Feature page and the Container Registry Price Details page. For more details, please visit the Azure Container Registry Documentation page.

  • 4/2Translator Text API officially released

    The Translator Text API is a neural machine translation service that developers can easily integrate into their applications websites, tools, or any solution requiring multi-language support such as website localization, e-commerce, customer support, messaging applications, internal communication, and more. It can be used to translate text in near real-time through a simple REST API call. It allows you to add multi-language user experiences in more than 60 languages, and can be used on any hardware platform with any operating system for text-to-text language translation.

    The Translator Text API is part of the Azure Cognitive Services API collection, and is readily consumable in your development projects.

    The Translator Text API has now been officially released. To understand more about this service and pricing, please visit Translator Text API Feature page and Translator Text API Price Details page. For more details, please visit Translator Text API Documentation.

  • 4/1Azure CDN for China regions with global coverage officially released

    Azure CDN improves application performance by caching content to the location nearest the customer. CDN stands for content delivery network. Virtually all large-scale websites use the Content Delivery Network technology today, but the technology is by no means exclusive to large websites. The basic purpose of the network is to avoid bottlenecks and other parts of the Internet that could affect data transfer rates and stability, to make content transfers faster and more stable. By placing node servers in different places across the network and building a more intelligent layer of virtual networks by using the Internet as a foundation, Content Delivery Network systems can redirect user requests in real time to the service node closest to the user based on the status of network traffic and node connections and loads, as well as overall information on distance to the user and response times.

    Content Delivery Network Standard Plus for Zone 1 and Standard with global coverage for Zone 2 have now been officially released. To understand more about this service, please visit Content Delivery Network Feature page and Content Delivery Network Price Details page. For more details, please visit Content Delivery Network Documentation page.

March 2019

  • 3/11Alert rules feature of Azure Monitor officially released in China East and China North data centers

    Azure Monitor is a platform function used to monitor and control Azure resources. Azure Monitor allows you to gather detailed performance and usage data, activity and diagnostic logs, and notifications, in a consistent way. You can use Azure portal to view and analyze monitoring data and set up alert-based automated actions. Alerts proactively notify you when important conditions are found in your monitoring data. They allow you to identify and address issues before the users of your system notice them.

    Alert rules are separated from alerts and the action that are taken when an alert fires.

    The key attributes of an alert rule are: target resource, signal, criteria, alert name, alert description, severity, and action.
